quote: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Courage, dear heart.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, ‘What! You too? I thought I was the only one.’
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Integrity is doing the right thing, even when no one is watching.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: We are what we believe we are.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: You can make anything by writing.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Failures are finger posts on the road to achievement.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person’s ultimate good as far as it can be obtained.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: We laugh at honor and are shocked to find traitors in our midst.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Aim at heaven and you will get earth ‘thrown in’: aim at earth and you will get neither.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Education without values, as useful as it is, seems rather to make man a more clever devil.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Miracles do not, in fact, break the laws of nature.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Isn’t it funny how day by day nothing changes, but when you look back, everything is different.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Nothing you have not given away will ever really be yours.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: To love is to be vulnerable.
author: C.S. Lewis
